intro: Psychotria egensis, commonly known as the Amazonian evergreen or the sacred plant of the Sateré-Mawé people, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is also known for its alkaloid content, including harmine and harmaline, which have psychoactive properties. Due to its cultural and medicinal significance, it is often cultivated and used in traditional practices.
